A4.text: Lower Egypt in the north, while a rival clan based in Thebes, the Intef family, took control of Upper Egypt in the south.

A5.text: Large seagoing ships are known to have been heavily used by the Egyptians in their trade with the city states of the eastern Mediterranean, especially Byblos (on the coast of modern-day Lebanon), and in several expeditions down the Red Sea to the Land of Punt.
